name: Nichkhun
description:
'''Nichkhun Buck Horvejkul''' ({{langx|th|นิชคุณ หรเวชกุล}}; {{RTGS|''Nitchakhun Horawetchakun''}}; born June 24, 1988), better known mononymously as '''Nichkhun''' ({{langx|ko|닉쿤}}{{efn|Within the Korean entertainment industry and in Korean-language printed media, his name is rendered as "Nick-kun" in [[Hangeul]] due to a misspelling by a staff member when he joined JYP Entertainment. In Thai, the ''ch'' in his name is pronounced as [tʃ] (as in "cheese"). He later stated in an interview that he never corrected the error after realizing that Koreans found it easier to pronounce "Nick-kun" and viewed it as a nickname.<ref>{{cite news|title="니치쿤보다 닉쿤 발음이 더 쉽죠 잉∼"|url=https://www.donga.com/news/Culture/article/all/20090521/8734355/9|work=[[The Dong-a Ilbo]]|date=May 21, 2009|language=ko}}</ref>}}), is a Thai and [[Americans|American]] rapper, singer, songwriter, actor, and model who is currently based in South Korea as a member of the South Korean boy band [[2PM]]. Nichkhun is widely considered to be the first Southeast Asian individual to debut in a K-pop idol group and achieve success, and he has worked on several campaigns for the [[Tourism Authority of Thailand]].

As a solo artist, Nichkhun has released two [[Extended play|EPs]]. As an actor, he has starred in various Korean, Thai, and Chinese dramas and films such as ''[[Seven Something]]'' (2012), ''[[One and a Half Summer]]'' (2014), and ''[[Brother of the Year]]'' (2018). He has also worked as a television personality on several variety and reality programs such as [[We Got Married|''We Got Married'']], ''[[We K-Pop]]'', and ''[[Idol on Quiz]].''
